channel.title: Uptime on warrick.io
channel.description: Recent content in Uptime on warrick.io

item.title: shell uptime
item.description: Bash has many reserved variables, but one of the most fun for screen junkies is the $SECONDS variable, which displays “the number of seconds since the shell was started”. $ echo $SECONDS 2012339 $ echo $(($SECONDS/60)) minutes 33541 minutes $ echo $(($SECONDS/60/60)) hours 559 hours $ echo $(($SECONDS/60/60/24)) days 23 days http://tldp.org/LDP/Bash-Beginners-Guide/html/sect_03_02.html
